issue.title: [Question] Will Parameter Context be set to outgoing http request context?
issue.body:
## Problem statement
In opentracing, the tracer will Inject http header with opentracing span meta data. We usually create a request.Context that encapsulates all the span meta before sending out via the raw http Client Do function. Since for swagger, the raw http client is deep inside the framework, it is not as obvsious of how to do it. 
If I just use WithContext on a swagger generated parameter, will the user created request.Context be also encapsualed as in using raw http client?

Opentracing will generate some random ID at runtime and those ID are not available via any API, so cannot assume the same level of control as requestID. And as request hop from one service to another, there will be another wrapping, so don;t think I can put that in swagger spec either.

Opentracing library of injecting into http header:
```
https://github.com/opentracing/opentracing-go/blob/bd9c3193394760d98b2fa6ebb2291f0cd1d06a7d/propagation.go#L161
```

Please remove the sections that don't apply

## Swagger specification

## Steps to reproduce

## Environment
swagger version: x.x.x  
go version: x.x.x  
OS:

body: Looks like some mismatch from vendor packages
@ huikang dep ensure was run and vendor dir was deleted
--with-context has no actual effect we should remove the option

issue.title: Deprecates `--with-context` option
issue.body:
The command line flags remains active (older CLI scripts still work),
but the flag is ignored.

Templates are cleaned up from this unsupported variant, including stratoscale.

* fixes #1684

Signed-off-by: Frederic BIDON <fredbi@yahoo.com>

issue.title: Update go-swagger to latest upstream v0.19.0.
issue.body:
Used actively maintained go-bindata fork from github.com/kevinburke/go-bindata
to regenerate bindata.go.
Removed WithContext flag which has been deprecated, see https://github.com/go-swagger/go-swagger/issues/1684 for context.
